ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: For anyone interested in science and policy, this is an incredibly useful, applicable class. While some of the topics will be frustrating because there is rarely a "right" answer or approach, this is appropriate given the collaborative nature of synthesizing science for policy.

I recommend this class to anyone interested in the interface between science and policy. It will change how you think about the role of scientific knowledge and how science becomes translated into actionable policy.

A really interesting examination of the boundaries between scientists and policymakers. Definitely take it if you're a scientist interested in policy applications, or if you want to work for a government agency that relies on scientific work. The course is only in its second year, so they're still working out some bugs, but all in all, it was an intense intellectual experience and very worthwhile.
